185983611.review:
Overrated. Definitely. The main disadvantage is poor characters. They are more like sketches and overly exaggerated. So the dialogues are empty and drawn out. It looks like an average teen drama. But frankly, it is really difficult to create something that reflects the existential problems of late puberty better than "13 reasons why" - so it’s really feebly in comparison. The antagonist is a complete disappointment. The authors diligently tried to discribe the inner logic of a maniacal psychopath, but it seems like they give up halfway. It came off indistinctly. The game mechanics and puzzles are simple, but nice. 

As plus - there are emotionally difficult moments, dilemmas and choices that really significantly affect the plot + the last location is nice at surrealistic way. In general, the game can be affecting, but it is better to play at an earlier age. If you've dealt with your teen rebel and outcast complex, it's not very interesting anymore.

The game is small, so it's possible and even pleasant to spend one evening - there are beautiful graphics and visual metaphors.

185970997.review:
[h1]Life is Strange (2015)[/h1]

Bem, vou começar essa análise comentando o quanto eu sempre quis jogar Life is Strange (2015), mas fui adiando por falta de tempo, disponibilidade, e pela dedicação e calma que esse jogo exige. Não é um game para rushar, mas para aproveitar ao máximo cada detalhe do mapa e conversa (e sim, são muitos detalhes e muitas conversas kkkkkk).
Com o tempo, esse jogo virou um "amuleto de responsabilidade": eu sabia que um dia teria que jogar. Sei que a Dontnod Entertainment e a franquia Life is Strange passaram por mudanças significativas ao longo dos anos. Pelo que cheguei a conferir, concordo com quem diz que os jogos mais recentes ficaram mais rasos comparados à profundidade narrativa do primeiro título. Mas isso não vem ao caso, porque estou avaliando apenas essa obra de 2015, sem considerar a versão "remaster" que, pelo que ouvi, veio cheia de bugs e problemas de otimização.
Estou aqui para analisar ESSE JOGO como se estivéssemos em 2015, e essa obra-prima tivesse acabado de ser lançada. Vamos lá!

[h2]Pontos Positivos[/h2]

Narrativa e Construção de Personagens: É incrível como um jogo consegue explorar tantos personagens ao mesmo tempo! Mesmo os coadjuvantes, apresentados de forma mais superficial, têm suas personalidades e ações bem definidas. Diferente de muitos jogos recentes do gênero, Life is Strange é, sem dúvida, um dos melhores jogos de escolhas já feitos. Suas decisões têm impacto real, seja em algo simples, como uma mensagem SMS diferente, ou em mudanças significativas na história. Isso é simplesmente perfeito.

Gráficos: Não há muito o que criticar aqui. O estilo artístico é único e foge do realismo, o que foi uma escolha inteligente para um jogo indie com orçamento limitado. Isso permitiu que os recursos fossem direcionados para áreas mais importantes, como a narrativa.

Ambientação: Mesmo sem gráficos realistas, você consegue se imergir totalmente nos cenários, como se estivesse vivendo aquela realidade. Isso é incrível! Muitos jogos da época e até mais modernos não conseguem fazer isso. Life is Strange é um exemplo de como "os diferentes" se destacam.

Momentos VIBE para reflexão: Desde a primeira vez que joguei, esses momentos me chamaram atenção. O jogo te dá uma pausa, combinando música com cenas contemplativas que te fazem refletir. Eu nunca tinha visto algo assim e admiro muito esse recurso. Ele traz uma profundidade emocional que poucos jogos conseguem.

Avalanche de Acontecimentos: A escolha de dividir o jogo em episódios foi genial, tanto para adaptar feedbacks quanto para gerenciar o orçamento. E o melhor é que a história não para: cada início, meio e fim de episódio aumenta ainda mais a vontade de continuar jogando. O roteiro é simplesmente impecável.

[b]Mais que um jogo: Life is Strange, na minha opinião, é muito mais do que apenas um jogo, ele é uma experiência profundamente emocional que ressoa com muitos jogadores, conectando-se diretamente com suas vidas pessoais, especialmente para aqueles que estão enfrentando momentos difíceis. A narrativa é envolvente e aborda escolhas morais e imorais, além de temas como amizade, perda e superação. Esses elementos criam um ambiente único, que convida à reflexão e proporciona serenidade, funcionando como uma pausa necessária em meio a uma rotina agitada e frustrante. As escolhas impecáveis de trilha sonora, os cenários tranquilos e o ritmo mais lento conseguem trazer uma calma que muitas pessoas precisam. Além disso, a conexão com os personagens torna fácil para o jogador se sentir compreendido e menos sozinho. Para mim, Life is Strange foi mais do que entretenimento; foi quase uma forma de terapia. Dedicar meu tempo a ele, com calma e curiosidade, durante um período de férias, me trouxe um conforto imenso. Foi uma experiência que ficou marcada de forma especial.[/b]

[h2]Pontos Negativos[/h2]

O Excesso de Culpa: Se tem algo que me incomodou foi o excesso de culpa que os personagens principais começam a assumir nos capítulos finais. Todo mundo quer carregar o peso do mundo nas costas, e isso se torna frustrante. Na vida real, assim como no jogo, é importante lembrar que nem tudo é culpa de uma só pessoa. As coisas simplesmente "acontecem". Nossa missão é superar, não se culpar por tudo.

[h2]Considerações Finais[/h2]

Enfim, Life is Strange é uma obra fantástica, como eu sempre imaginei. Recomendo fortemente para quem ainda não jogou. Talvez seja melhor optar pela versão original em vez do "remaster" (se ainda estiver disponível para compra), mas de qualquer forma, será uma experiência inesquecível.
Eu chorei em vários momentos dessa jornada e espero que todos que joguem também sintam essa conexão profunda. Espero que os futuros títulos da franquia tentem voltar às origens, mas de qualquer forma, meu muito obrigado à Dontnod por criar algo tão especial. Esse jogo, para mim, é um 10/10 para SEMPRE. [b]E sim, a vida é MUITO ESTRANHA! =)[/b]

185970627.review:
Okay, let’s be real here—Life is Strange 1 is a masterpiece. If you haven't played it yet, what are you doing with your life? Are you really living if you haven’t had your heart shattered by the ultimate time-traveling teen drama? I think not.

Let’s talk about Chloe for a second. Yeah, I know, she’s the rebellious, foul-mouthed, eyeliner-loving punk we all secretly want to be, but she’s also that friend who’s a disaster in the best way possible. I mean, who else would get you into the most ridiculous, yet somehow heartwarming, situations? Chloe is my forever fave, I’ll admit it. If she were real, I’d probably have a shrine dedicated to her in my closet (don’t judge me).

But... Alex Chen? I’m sorry, Chloe, but my heart belongs to her now. I mean, come on—she’s got empathy powers and an emotional depth that makes my heart flutter in ways I didn’t know were possible. Chloe may have been the gateway, but Alex? She’s my real girl. Chloe can keep the tattoos, but Alex can have my soul.

The story is emotional, the choices are meaningful (and will haunt you forever), and the soundtrack? I’m still pretending I’m living my best indie movie life every time I hear that intro song. If you enjoy anything remotely related to time travel, emotional wreckage, or tearing your heart apart over fictional characters, this is your game. It’ll give you all the feels, and then leave you questioning whether you should be doing something productive with your life or just sitting in your room re-playing the game for the fifth time.

In conclusion, Life is Strange 1 is a must-play. Will it make you cry? Absolutely. Will it ruin your emotional stability? Probably. But will you love it anyway? Oh, you bet. Just remember, Chloe’s awesome, but Alex Chen is the one that stole my heart. Sorry, Chloe.

185852300.review:
Regrettably, the game failed to deliver a satisfying experience. A significant drawback is the abundance of scenes where the player is reduced to a passive observer, with little to no ability to influence the unfolding narrative. Despite the developers' assurances that player choices would shape the progression of events, the gameplay is disappointingly linear, undermining the promise of meaningful interactivity.
The demo version further detracted from the experience by placing disproportionate focus on specific themes. Topics such as global warming, the promotion of vaping over smoking, and even references to drug use felt unnecessary and out of context. Moreover, the overt inclusion of gender-related messaging within the narrative appeared forced and detracted from immersion. These elements collectively shifted the focus away from engaging storytelling and meaningful gameplay.
The game would benefit from greater emphasis on player agency, a more compelling narrative, and a subtler approach to integrating thematic elements. As it stands, the experience fell short of expectations, and I see no reason to continue beyond the demo version.

185805825.review:
Zerei o primeiro e todos os outros da franquia – um mergulho em emoções que nunca vou esquecer.

Fala, galera! Hoje quero falar de uma das minhas franquias favoritas: Life is Strange. Eu já era apaixonada por jogos de efeito borboleta desde que joguei Until Dawn, mas quando comecei o primeiro Life is Strange, foi como se o jogo falasse diretamente comigo. É uma experiência que vai muito além de um jogo – é arte pura, uma jornada emocional.

História e Efeitos Borboleta
A narrativa é, sem dúvida, o ponto mais forte de Life is Strange. A forma como as escolhas impactam a história é simplesmente brilhante. Desde pequenas decisões, como responder a uma mensagem, até os momentos cruciais que mudam o destino dos personagens, tudo te prende e faz você repensar suas ações.

E, olha, eu ri, chorei, fiquei tensa, me assustei... Foi um turbilhão de emoções do início ao fim. A escolha final do primeiro jogo, em especial, mexeu tanto comigo que precisei de uns bons minutos pra processar tudo. É aquele tipo de jogo que fica com você mesmo depois de desligar.

Trilha Sonora: Uma Obra-Prima
Se tem algo que eleva Life is Strange a outro nível, é a trilha sonora. As músicas não são apenas um pano de fundo; elas são parte da experiência. Cada faixa parece ter sido escolhida a dedo pra amplificar as emoções das cenas. Eu nunca vou esquecer a sensação de ouvir "Spanish Sahara" no final de um episódio, ou "Obstacles" tocando na abertura.

Sério, a trilha sonora é tão boa que virou parte da minha playlist do dia a dia. É impossível ouvir essas músicas sem ser transportada de volta pra Arcadia Bay ou qualquer outro cenário do jogo.

Jogabilidade e Exploração
Agora, sendo bem honesta, Life is Strange não é sobre liberdade de exploração. Se você espera um mundo aberto, pode se decepcionar. Ele é mais linear, guiado pela história, e isso pode incomodar quem está acostumada a jogos que te deixam andar por aí e fazer o que quiser.

Por outro lado, a linearidade não é algo negativo pra mim, porque tudo é tão bem construído que você nem sente falta de "fazer mais coisas". Cada cenário é cheio de detalhes que contam histórias por si só – basta prestar atenção. E o poder de manipular o tempo no primeiro jogo? Gente, que mecânica incrível! Mexer no tempo não só te ajuda a corrigir erros, mas também te faz explorar novas possibilidades narrativas. É genial.

Personagens e Relacionamentos
Os personagens de Life is Strange são o coração do jogo. Você se conecta com eles de uma forma que é difícil de explicar. Max e Chloe têm uma dinâmica que me fez torcer por elas a cada momento. E os personagens secundários também têm suas camadas – ninguém é completamente bom ou mau. Eles são humanos (menos aquele bosta), com falhas e virtudes, e isso deixa a experiência ainda mais real.

E a diversidade de temas? Nossa, Life is Strange aborda assuntos que muitos jogos evitam: bullying, depressão, suicídio, identidade... É um jogo corajoso que te faz refletir sobre a vida.

Pontos Positivos
História impactante com escolhas que realmente importam.
Trilha sonora excepcional, que eleva cada cena a um nível emocional incrível.
Personagens complexos e relacionáveis, que te fazem sentir parte da história.
Mecânica de manipulação do tempo (no primeiro jogo), super criativa e bem utilizada.
Abordagem de temas sensíveis com muita sensibilidade e profundidade.

Pontos Negativos
Linearidade, que pode desagradar quem gosta de mais liberdade de exploração.
Algumas decisões não têm tanto impacto na história quanto você espera (mas isso é mais perceptível depois de jogar várias vezes).
Ritmo lento em alguns momentos, especialmente se você não está no clima pra algo mais introspectivo.

Vale a Pena?
Se você ainda não jogou, Life is Strange é uma experiência que precisa estar no seu radar. É mais do que um jogo – é uma jornada emocional que vai te fazer rir, chorar e repensar a vida. A falta de liberdade de exploração não tira o brilho da narrativa e dos personagens. E, sério, a trilha sonora por si só já vale o ingresso.

Minha nota? 9/10.
É um jogo lindo, que me marcou profundamente e que recomendo pra todo mundo que gosta de histórias bem contadas e experiências emocionais.

185775447.review:
I've been wondering for a long time whether "Life is Strange" is a game I could recommend or not, since it has very positive reviews and a slew of fans. I also expected such an experience. Unfortunately, I have to admit that the game disappointed me. Don't get me wrong, I fell in love with the demo version (chapter one), which promised an elaborate crime story with several suspects and lots of decision-making. We were introduced to the characters along with our heroine (Max), as she was new to the school. It promised a story full of excitement, mystery and consequences of our choices.

Unfortunately, after purchasing the full version of the game, with all the chapters (21 hours played), the spell faded in several different ways:

1. The game turned out to be a delusion of the consequences of the choices (except for the final decision at the end - although this one is disappointing in terms of the logic of the choice and the realization of the consequences, especially in the case of one final).
 
2. The game deliberately distracts us from some characters, completely forgetting them as criminal suspects. Because of this, we are unable to gather evidence in their case. Which is then supposed to cause surprise, shock, etc. - A cheap, ineffective ploy.

3. Overly cinematic final chapters. At one point in the game, there was so much story told in interludes and stills that for most of the chapter, the player had nothing to do but minor linear activities that contributed nothing. This killed my immersion and and even more my sense of control and decision-making.

4. Little bugs. The ending cutscenes have a number of close-ups of characters talking without their mouths moving. There are so many of them that at some point it becomes uncomfortable. The time reversal system is also sometimes unintuitive and can erase a decision even though it was not intended.

**[Warning: little spoilers]**

5. Final decisions: It is supposed to arouse emotions, but whether it does so is not necessarily the case. The first ending looks good and emotional, but the second one is dull and bland. In addition, it shows that everything we did throughout the game is irrelevant to our protagonist Max (all the friendships we've made, the lives we saved, etc.). That's not how you write good endings.

6. Imbalance in the characterization of the characters. Just as most of the characters are good written (they have their own motives, secrets, behaviors and are believable), I cannot say the same about two of the main characters who should arouse sympathy - Chloe and (maybe) Warren.
The friendship between Max and Chloe is, in my opinion, completely one-sided. Chloe uses Max's skills like a toy, she doesn't accept criticism, she's explosive and I didn't get the impression that she actually cared about her friend or even respected her, her character and way of being. Thus, he forces her to engage in various activities, even though Max points out that such activities are not to her liking or even can hurt her. Despite this, Max keeps repeating wonderful words about lifelong friendship and can also create a love bond with her. The only positive aspect of Chloe's character is at the end, when she realizes all these elements and talks about them, and makes her first unselfish decision.
As for Warren, he's written strangely. He's supposed to be a geek with a crush on Max, and he basically is, but throughout the entire game I had the impression that there was something strange about him and that he was hiding something.

185686754.review:
Life is Strange is a game with an interesting premise and some good aspects, but ultimately it's ruined by two fatal flaws: your choices don't actually matter, and the ending is dogshit.

First, choices. Constantly throughout the game you get the chance to make choices, at which point you'll see a little message saying "This action will have consequences". What the game doesn't tell you though is that most of these "consequences" are totally meaningless. The worst offender is the plant - each chapter you have the option to water a plant, after which the game will say "This action will have consequences". I remember back when the game was still releasing episodically, it was so much fun to speculate what the hell the consequences of watering a damn plant could be. It turns out the consequence is in the last chapter you get one line of dialogue where Max says whether the plant is looking healthy or not. That's literally it. The game constantly gives you the illusion that you're making choices when really they don't change anything. That being said, there is one part of the game where the story can actually branch substantially, since you can affect whether a certain character lives or dies. I think this is where Life is Strange is at its best and it shows the potential the game could have had, but the problem is that this is the only time it happens. For a fully story-based game supposedly all about player choice, you'd think that's what the whole game would be like, but unfortunately most of it is all smoke and mirrors.

However even though I praised the one time where your choices matter, it actually still doesn't matter because of the ending. You would think in a game like this, your choices throughout the game would determine what ending you get, but of course not. Instead you just get one final choice right at the end, and that's your ending. It reminds me of Mass Effect 3, except at least Mass Effect 3 had three options whereas LiS only has two. All this would be fine if the endings were good, but unfortunately 1) both endings are totally stupid and trite, and 2) without spoiling what happens, both endings effectively make all your previous choices not matter. This is why I think Life is Strange is a failure. Mass Effect may have botched its ending, but at least it had shooting and RPG gameplay to lean on. Life is Strange is nothing but story, so there's no excuse. It's like, you had one job. There are still things to enjoy about the game, but for a game that's supposed to all be about story and choices, I think they dropped the ball.

All this and I haven't even talked about the third reason why I think the game doesn't work, which is the character of Chloe, but I'm not going to go into it because I think even if Chloe was written better, I would still be disappointed by the ending and lack of payoff anyway.

Now as for why this game seems to have such a fanbase despite its, to me, clear problems, the only explanation I can think of is I think there's certain demographic of people who will enjoy any slop as long as it has lesbians in it. Like based on forum posts I've read, that usually seems to be what people care about the most with this game. Now don't get me wrong, I'm something of a queer myself, and normally I like sapphic stuff, but I don't think it outweighs the game's failures. But, if that's all you care about, don't let me stop you.

Une aventure émotionnelle inoubliable 🌟

Life is Strange n'est pas juste un jeu, c'est une expérience qui reste gravée dans votre mémoire longtemps après l'avoir terminé. Ce chef-d'œuvre narratif mélange une histoire captivante, des personnages incroyablement bien écrits, et une ambiance unique qui vous transporte immédiatement dans la petite ville d'Arcadia Bay.

L’utilisation des mécaniques de retour dans le temps ajoute une dimension fascinante aux choix que vous faites, vous poussant à réfléchir à leurs conséquences immédiates et à long terme. Ces décisions, souvent déchirantes, donnent au jeu un sentiment d'implication rare.

La relation entre Max et Chloe est au cœur du jeu et brillamment construite. On ressent leurs émotions, leurs doutes et leur amitié comme si on vivait à leurs côtés. La bande-son, quant à elle, est tout simplement parfaite : chaque morceau amplifie l’ambiance et vous immerge encore plus dans cet univers mélancolique et poétique.

Life is Strange ne se contente pas de raconter une histoire : il traite avec profondeur de thèmes comme l’amitié, le deuil, le harcèlement ou encore l’identité, toujours avec beaucoup de sensibilité.

Note : 10/10 – Un voyage émouvant et inoubliable qui marquera votre cœur. ❤️

185678593.review:
Jogabilidade e Controles:
Life is Strange é um jogo de aventura episódico desenvolvido pela Dontnod Entertainment. A jogabilidade é simples e acessível, com foco na exploração, interações e escolhas. O jogador assume o controle de Max Caulfield, uma estudante de fotografia que descobre ter a habilidade de voltar no tempo.

Os controles são intuitivos, e as mecânicas de retroceder no tempo adicionam uma camada única à jogabilidade, permitindo que o jogador experimente diferentes escolhas e veja as consequências imediatas antes de decidir. É uma experiência fácil para jogadores de todos os níveis, com uma platina acessível e prazerosa de conquistar. Nota 9.

Gráficos e Design Visual:
Os gráficos de Life is Strange têm um estilo artístico diferenciado, com um design que combina traços realistas e estilizados. Embora não seja o jogo mais tecnicamente avançado, seu visual é encantador e combina perfeitamente com a atmosfera da narrativa.

Os cenários refletem a pequena cidade de Arcadia Bay de maneira autêntica e envolvente, criando um pano de fundo que intensifica a conexão emocional do jogador com a história. Os efeitos visuais das habilidades temporais de Max são simples, mas eficientes em transmitir a importância das escolhas. Nota 9.

História e Narrativa:
A história é o ponto mais forte de Life is Strange. O enredo emocionante e bem escrito acompanha Max e sua melhor amiga Chloe enquanto elas investigam o desaparecimento de uma colega e descobrem segredos sombrios sobre Arcadia Bay.

As escolhas do jogador têm impacto direto no desenrolar da trama, o que torna cada decisão importante e emocionalmente carregada. A narrativa aborda temas como amizade, perda, arrependimento e crescimento pessoal, fazendo com que o jogador reflita profundamente sobre suas próprias escolhas. É uma história que emociona e conecta, sendo o grande diferencial do jogo. Nota 10.
[20:55]
Trilha Sonora e Ambientação:
Embora a trilha sonora seja excelente, sua presença é limitada, e em alguns momentos do jogo, uma música adicional poderia ter melhorado a experiência emocional e a imersão. As canções que estão presentes são marcantes e ajudam a criar uma conexão emocional mais profunda, mas o jogo poderia ter explorado melhor esse aspecto.

Por outro lado, a ambientação é bem construída, com cada local de Arcadia Bay trazendo um charme próprio e contribuindo para a imersão do jogador no mundo do jogo. Nota 8.5.

Impacto Geral e Conclusão:
Life is Strange é um jogo que impressiona pela narrativa e pela maneira como envolve o jogador em uma história profundamente emocional e reflexiva. A simplicidade da jogabilidade torna o jogo acessível, enquanto o roteiro e as escolhas criam uma experiência única e memorável.

Apesar da trilha sonora limitada em alguns momentos, o jogo compensa com uma ambientação encantadora e uma história cativante. É um jogo que emociona aqueles que se dispõem a explorar sua profundidade e a se conectar com seus personagens.

Dou nota 9.5/10 a Life is Strange e recomendo fortemente a todos que buscam um jogo emocionante e impactante.

Nota: 9.5/10

185662425.review:
Life is Strange, developed by Dontnod Entertainment, is a poignant narrative adventure that explores friendship, identity, and the ripple effects of choice. It’s a deeply emotional experience, blending grounded storytelling with a supernatural twist, set against the backdrop of the fictional town of Arcadia Bay.

You play as Max Caulfield, a shy photography student who discovers she can rewind time. This newfound ability becomes central to the story, as Max grapples with its moral and emotional consequences while trying to reconnect with her estranged best friend, Chloe Price. Together, they unravel a dark mystery involving missing persons, secrets, and the fate of their town.

What makes Life is Strange truly special is its focus on relationships and character-driven storytelling. The bond between Max and Chloe is the emotional core of the game, portrayed with raw authenticity. Their dialogues, shared memories, and struggles resonate deeply, making their journey feel personal.

The time-rewind mechanic is a brilliant addition, allowing you to experiment with choices and see their immediate outcomes. Yet, it’s not a simple solution to every problem, the game forces you to confront the fact that some decisions have no perfect answer, and the consequences of your actions often ripple far beyond your control.

Visually, Life is Strange has a distinctive, painterly art style that captures the beauty and melancholy of Arcadia Bay. From the warm hues of a sunset to the eerie shadows of a stormy night, the game’s environments feel both intimate and immersive. The soundtrack, featuring indie tracks by artists like Syd Matters and José González, is a standout feature. Each song is perfectly chosen to amplify the emotional beats of the story, creating moments of quiet reflection.

The pacing, however, can feel uneven at times, with some sequences dragging compared to the more intense or dramatic moments. Additionally, while the dialogue captures the earnestness of its teenage characters, it occasionally ventures into awkward territory.

Life is Strange doesn’t just tell a story, it makes you feel it. It’s a game about growing up, facing hard truths, and learning to let go. The choices you make as Max shape not only the narrative but also your connection to the characters and the world around them.

The finale is a gut-wrenching culmination of all your decisions, offering no easy answers but leaving a lasting impression. Few games manage to capture the complexity of human emotion and relationships as authentically as Life is Strange.

If you value storytelling, relatable characters, and experiences that linger long after the credits roll, Life is Strange is a must-play. It’s a game that asks you not just to play it but to feel it, and that’s what makes it unforgettable.

185426410.review:
Life is Strange, hikaye anlatımına odaklanan bir macera oyunu olarak oyun dünyasında eşsiz bir yere sahiptir. Oyun, oyunculara genç bir fotoğrafçılık öğrencisi olan Max Caulfield’ın gözünden unutulmaz bir deneyim sunuyor. Max’in zamanda geri gitme yeteneğini keşfetmesiyle başlayan hikaye, sıradan bir gençlik hikayesinden hızla çıkarak derin temalarla dolu bir yolculuğa dönüşüyor. Oyun, yalnızca karakterlerin yaşadığı olayları değil, aynı zamanda oyuncunun ahlaki kararlarını ve bu kararların sonuçlarını da öne çıkarıyor. Bu yönüyle Life is Strange, sadece bir oyun olmaktan öteye geçerek interaktif bir drama haline geliyor.

Oyunun atmosferi ve görsel tasarımı, deneyimi daha da unutulmaz kılıyor. Çizgi roman estetiği ile gerçekçi unsurları birleştiren grafik tarzı, Arcadia Bay’in büyüleyici ama melankolik havasını mükemmel bir şekilde yansıtıyor. Oyunun müzikleri de en az hikayesi kadar etkileyici. Folk ve indie tarzındaki şarkılar, hikayenin duygusal tonuyla kusursuz bir uyum içinde. Özellikle belirli sahnelerde kullanılan müzikler, oyuncuyu hikayenin içine çekerken, karakterlerle duygusal bir bağ kurmayı kolaylaştırıyor. Her bir detayın özenle işlendiği bu yapım, oyuncuların unutulmaz anılar biriktirmesine olanak tanıyor.

Life is Strange, yalnızca bir oyun değil, aynı zamanda hayata dair pek çok soruyu da sorgulatan bir deneyimdir. Dostluk, fedakârlık, kayıp ve seçimlerin sonuçları gibi evrensel temaları işleyen oyun, duygusal bir yolculuk arayan herkes için harika bir tercih. Hikaye boyunca yapılan seçimlerin farklı sonuçlara yol açması, oyuncuya hikayeyi kendi bakış açısına göre şekillendirme imkanı tanıyor. Life is Strange, oyunculara yalnızca bir macera sunmakla kalmıyor, aynı zamanda empati kurmayı, farklı perspektiflerden bakmayı ve hayatın karmaşıklığını anlamayı öğretiyor. Bu yüzden oyun, uzun süre unutulmayacak bir başyapıt olarak öne çıkıyor.


Life is Strange holds a unique place in the gaming world as a story-driven adventure game. The game offers an unforgettable experience through the eyes of Max Caulfield, a young photography student. Max’s discovery of her ability to rewind time transforms what begins as an ordinary coming-of-age story into a journey filled with profound themes. The game not only highlights the events experienced by the characters but also places the moral decisions of the player and their consequences at the forefront. In this way, Life is Strange goes beyond being just a game, becoming an interactive drama that deeply engages its audience.

The game’s atmosphere and visual design make the experience even more memorable. Combining a comic book aesthetic with realistic elements, its graphic style perfectly captures the enchanting yet melancholic vibe of Arcadia Bay. The music is just as impactful as the story itself. With its selection of folk and indie tracks, the soundtrack aligns seamlessly with the emotional tone of the narrative. The songs used in key scenes draw players into the story while fostering a deep emotional connection with the characters. Every detail is meticulously crafted, allowing players to create lasting memories throughout the journey.

Life is Strange is not merely a game but also an experience that prompts reflection on many aspects of life. By addressing universal themes like friendship, sacrifice, loss, and the consequences of choices, the game is a fantastic option for anyone seeking an emotional journey. The ability to shape the story based on the choices made provides players with a unique perspective and personalized experience. Life is Strange not only offers an adventure but also teaches empathy, the value of viewing situations from different angles, and the complexity of life. For this reason, it stands out as a masterpiece that will be remembered for years to come.

You play as Max Caulfield, a high school student who discovers she has the ability to rewind time. This power allows for unique decision-making moments that challenge you to consider the consequences of your actions.

The narrative touches on important themes like friendship, love, loss, mental health, and the effects of choices, making it a rich and thought-provoking experience. The game does an excellent job of blending supernatural elements with real-world issues, making it both fantastical and grounded.

Moreover, the visuals and soundtrack are stunning, with beautifully crafted environments and a hauntingly memorable music selection that perfectly complements the story's mood.

Another standout feature is the game's emphasis on player agency. Your decisions genuinely impact the story, offering a level of control over the narrative that makes each playthrough feel personal and unique.

If you're a fan of narrative-driven games that prioritize emotional depth, Life is Strange is an experience you won't want to miss.

185123521.review:
An Emotional Masterpiece of Storytelling

Life is Strange is a game that stays with you long after you’ve finished it. It’s a beautiful, emotional, and deeply personal journey that combines an engaging story with impactful choices and a unique artistic style. From start to finish, this game pulls you in with its heartfelt narrative and leaves you reflecting on life, friendship, and the weight of your decisions.

The story centers around Max Caulfield, a shy photography student who discovers she has the power to rewind time. What starts as a quirky mechanic quickly becomes the heart of the game, as Max uses her abilities to navigate a web of relationships, solve mysteries, and protect those she cares about. The game explores complex themes like friendship, loss, love, and identity, all while keeping you on the edge of your seat with its intriguing plot.

The characters are incredibly well-written and relatable, especially Max and her best friend, Chloe. Their bond feels authentic, with dialogue that captures the awkwardness, humor, and intensity of teenage friendships. The game’s emotional weight comes from the strength of its characters—you’ll care about their struggles, root for their success, and feel the impact of every choice you make.

Speaking of choices, Life is Strange excels at making you feel like your decisions matter. While the time-rewind mechanic allows you to explore multiple outcomes, every action has consequences, and the game constantly challenges you to weigh your options. It’s rare to find a game where the moral dilemmas feel this impactful and personal.

The art style is another highlight. The watercolor-inspired visuals and muted color palette give the game a unique and artistic feel, perfectly capturing the small-town vibe of Arcadia Bay. Combined with the incredible soundtrack, which features indie songs that set the tone for every scene, the atmosphere is nothing short of magical.

While the gameplay leans heavily on exploration and dialogue, it suits the story perfectly. This isn’t an action-packed game—it’s a narrative-driven experience that prioritizes emotional connection over traditional gameplay mechanics.

Life is Strange is more than just a game—it’s an emotional rollercoaster that will make you laugh, cry, and think about the moments that shape us. Whether you’re a fan of narrative-driven games or just looking for something meaningful, this is an experience you don’t want to miss.

Confesso que abandonei Life is Strange umas três vezes, acreditando que não era o meu estilo de jogo, mas hoje me arrependo profundamente de não ter concluído essa obra mais cedo. Que experiência incrível! A história é extremamente envolvente, com reviravoltas surpreendentes (quem jogou sabe exatamente do que estou falando, especialmente no final do capítulo 4, onde fiquei por uns 30 minutos simplesmente em choque diante do que aconteceu).

O jogo não se esquiva de abordar temas sensíveis, o que, para mim, é um dos seus maiores méritos. Os gráficos são bons, embora não perfeitos — não concordo com aqueles que o consideram impecável, mas entendo que isso se deva às limitações do desenvolvimento e à necessidade de cortes na versão final. Mesmo assim, a qualidade geral compensa qualquer falha técnica.

É uma pena saber que algumas pessoas que eu não aprecio também são fãs deste jogo, mas deixo isso de lado, pois a experiência e as lições que ele proporciona superam qualquer preconceito. Life is Strange me ensinou muito, e por isso sou imensamente grato. É um jogo que nos faz refletir, emocionar e, principalmente, crescer.

184947659.review:
Life is Strange — это не просто игра, а настоящее интерактивное путешествие, которое заставляет задуматься о сложных темах, таких как дружба, потеря, выбор и их последствия. Разработанная студией Dontnod Entertainment и изданная Square Enix, эта эпизодическая игра привлекла внимание своим необычным стилем повествования и эмоциональной глубиной.

Что понравилось:
Сюжет: История Макс Колфилд, молодой фотографки с уникальной способностью управлять временем, захватывает с самого начала. Каждое событие, диалог и выбор имеют значение и погружают игрока в атмосферу небольшого городка Аркадия-Бэй.
Механика управления временем: Эта особенность делает геймплей уникальным. Возможность перемотать время назад позволяет исследовать разные варианты развития событий, что поднимает вопрос о том, действительно ли можно исправить свои ошибки.
Персонажи: Персонажи, особенно Макс и её подруга Хлоя, ощущаются настоящими и живыми. Их взаимоотношения — это центр истории, и за ними интересно наблюдать.
Атмосфера: Саундтрек, визуальный стиль и дизайн создают неповторимую атмосферу меланхолии и уюта. Музыка идеально дополняет настроение каждой сцены, вызывая сильные эмоции.
Темы: Игра затрагивает важные и актуальные темы: буллинг, депрессия, утрата, принятие себя. Это делает её не только развлекательной, но и глубокой с точки зрения повествования.

Что не понравилось:
Некоторые диалоги: Иногда разговоры между персонажами звучат немного неестественно, словно разработчики пытались угодить молодёжной аудитории.
Графика: Хотя стиль игры приятен глазу, технически графика кажется устаревшей, особенно в анимации лиц.
Темп: Некоторые эпизоды могут показаться затянутыми, что иногда замедляет динамику сюжета.

Общие впечатления:
Life is Strange — это игра, которая цепляет душу. Это не просто история, а эмоциональное приключение, где каждый выбор оставляет след в вашей памяти. Несмотря на технические недостатки, она выделяется своей искренностью, атмосферой и способностью вызывать сильные чувства.

Итог: Если вы любите игры с глубоким сюжетом, интригующими персонажами и морально сложными выборами, Life is Strange обязательно стоит попробовать. Это не просто игра — это переживание, которое остаётся с вами надолго.

Оценка: 8/10.

Как же хочется, чтобы всё шло по-твоему. Но жизнь устроена иначе. И стоит ли из-за этого злиться, ругаться с миром? Мы не можем повернуть время назад, как хотелось бы. Но как не поддаться соблазну этих мыслей — "А что если"?
Остался бы я тогда? Сказал бы все? Но всё казалось слишком нереальным, сказочным, словно это не про меня. Я боялся предать свою мечту. А был бы я счастлив, если бы рискнул остаться? Может, в этом и есть суть всего.
В играх, как Life is Strange, у нас есть выбор. Мы можем вернуться назад, перезаписать всё, прыгнув к нужному моменту. Но был бы я рад, если бы кто-то ответил за меня на все мои "А что если"? Наверное, именно в этом и прячется смысл. Если бы у меня была такая сила — осмелился бы я?
Это была первая игра, после которой я начал задумываться о многом. Можно сказать, она изменила меня. Помню, как в 12 или 13 лет скачал её. Тогда мне было стыдно показывать её другим, говорить о ней. Брат высмеял меня за то, что я играл в неё.Но был ли стыд из-за игры? Или из-за того, что у меня был такой брат? Что было бы, если бы я тогда ответил ему? Что бы изменилось?
Life is Strange учит, что не существует идеальных решений, но каждый выбор — это часть пути. Игра напоминает, что настоящая сила не в том, чтобы всё изменить, а в том, чтобы принять. И может быть, именно в этом и заключается смысл: искать ответы, жить с вопросами и ценить моменты, которые у нас есть.
И вот, снова я сажусь за очередную игру. Потому что в этих историях я ищу ответы. Или, может, просто учусь жить с вопросами.

Genuinly I can't spell genuinely but this game is beautiful. It's one of those games that just clicked with me. Not a second of my 16 hours of playtime, including sitting on the menu screen, was boring in any way. 

I watched play throughs of this game when I was younger, of which I remember pretty much nothing of, and for whatever reason I've always been drawn to this game. I seemingly forgot about it for a few years, until around a week ago when I was searching for a game to buy. I remembered Life is Strange, and decided to look it up on the steam store, to which I found out that the first episode is free. I played it, and absolutely fell in love with the game.

The first episode is free, just give the game a try, you may have a similar experience. It delves into topics in ways that many games have been unable to do, and looks and plays incredibly. The characters are memorable, the story doesn't feel too short or long, its just amazing. I haven't played the remastered version, but from what I saw of it, I genuinely think the original version looks better, it just has a charm that the remastered version doesn't seem to capture as well. 



This action will have consequences...

Um.. wow, this is.. I am speechless. It has been a psychological emotional everything emotions. Overall: 9.9/10

The first episode of Life is Strange introduces us to the main character Maxine (Max) Caulfield, who returns to her hometown of Arcadia Bay after a five-year absence. Max is a creative soul who enjoys analog photography and dreams of improving his life. Her return is connected with mysterious events that begin to unfold from the first minutes of the game.

The atmosphere of the game is reminiscent of David Lynch's “Twin Peaks”: a quiet, at first glance, town hides many dark secrets. Visually, the game is made at a high level, with attention to detail and textures, which creates a sense of immersion in a world full of references to popular culture.

Gameplay and mechanics:
This is not just a game, but rather an interactive movie with adventure elements. The main mechanic is time rewinding, which allows Max to go back a few minutes to change his actions or responses. This is not only an artistic device for storytelling, but also an important gameplay element that allows the player to correct their mistakes and find new ways to solve problems.

Positive:

The game is pleasing to the eye and creates a unique atmosphere full of details and cultural references.
The mechanics of rewinding time are not only interesting, but also deeply integrated into the gameplay, allowing the player to experiment with the consequences of their actions.
The characters of the game, especially Max and her childhood friend Chloe, evoke strong emotions and empathy.
The world around you is full of interesting little things that you can explore and interact with.

Minuses:

To fully understand and enjoy the game requires knowledge of references to popular culture, which can be difficult for some players.
Some tasks may not seem too difficult or interesting.
In the first episode, it is difficult to assess how the decisions made by the player will affect the further course of events.

Conclusion:
The first episode of Life is Strange leaves a strong impression due to its unique atmosphere, high-quality graphics and interesting mechanics. The game focuses more on exposure and familiarity with the characters than on complex puzzles or the consequences of decisions. For those who appreciate interactive stories and like to immerse themselves in detailed worlds, Life is Strange is an excellent choice.

184511401.review:
Life is Strange is a choice-driven narrative where you lives through the live of a college girl, Max, returning to her hometown and discovers her newfound time rewind power with her old bestfriend, Chloe.

Throughout the whole game, Max saw many unfortunate events happen through her own eyes. Just as Max was using her rewind power to right every small wrongs around her, (huge spoiler alerts) [spoiler]from saving her bestfriend from being shot to preventing car accidents that happen years ago[/spoiler], the game shows you the courses of events you have changed and hits you with a message that ultimately, there is something bigger in life than righting the wrongs. To me, Max's story tells us that there is so much in life that is out of our control, and no matter how horrible the consequence is, we will need to learn to adapt to it.

The aesthetics in game are hand-painted and give you an artsy and authentic feel. The writing and voice actor lines are quirky and don't shy away from expressing different dimension of a typical teenager (e.g. awkwardness, punk attitude). I also love the way they use their soundtracks to do the storytelling, like Obstacles, To All of You, Spanish Sahara. I listen to the tracks outside of the game and honestly, they not only tell you a bit of some characters' music taste, the lyrics of the tracks also make sense in the story context. I sometime suspect they build cut scenes or story context around an entire track.

Would highly recommend for people who like story-driven game or just high school drama in general - 10/10

184499073.review:
"Life is Strange" — это уникальный интерактивный эпизодический приключенческий игровой проект, который не только погружает игрока в захватывающую историю, но и предлагает глубоко человечный подход к эмоциональным и моральным дилеммам. 

Одной из сильнейших сторон данной игры является развитие персонажей. Основные и второстепенные персонажи проработаны до мелочей, у каждого из них есть свои мечты, страхи и переживания, что делает их более реалистичными и близкими.

Игра также поднимает важные социальные темы, такие как буллинг, депрессия и вопросы идентичности. Присутствующие трогательные моменты заставляют задуматься над тем, как наши действия влияют на других, и что иногда выбор, который кажется правильным на первый взгляд, может иметь непредсказуемые последствия.

"Life is Strange" — это не просто игра, а опыт, в который стоит погрузиться, исследуя сложные вопрос о выборах и их последствиях.

如果你有了回溯时间的能力，最想做什么？都说1代是神作建议玩1，然而总5个章节玩下来除了第1章开端悬念和第5章收尾，别的3个章节又臭又长且毫无亮点。荒野大镖客和死亡搁浅这种公认慢节奏的我都很喜欢，可以想象这个游戏是多么无趣。

184353046.review:
Не очень люблю смотреть фильмы. Может данная характеристика в моем резюме, очень долгое время отпугивала меня от игр жанра, интерактивное кино. Тогда нет ничего удивительного учитывая, что Life is Strange лежит у меня в библиотеке еще с далекого 2020г. Но вот у меня небольшая депрессия, за очередной экшен садится нет желания. Листаю библиотеку стим, натыкаюсь на этого мастодонта интерактивных фильмов. Слышу хвалебные отзывы, решаюсь поиграть, прохожу и вот уже пишу свое мнение в отзыв. Но по порядку.

	Нас встречает небольшой городок на побережье моря, Аркадия-Бэй. Встречает и влюбляет в себя. Тихий городишко, в глубине штата, где жизнь проходит своим чередом, где все всех знают и где не укроется ни одна тайна. А тайн тут очень много, поверьте. Сетинг и место действия одно из моих самых любимых, авансом ставим игре + к общему балу.

	Играем мы за подростка по имени Максим Колфилд. Тихая и спокойная девочка, которая возвращается с большого и шумного Сиэтла, в свой родной небольшой городок. Возвращается за своей мечтой, учится в одного из самых популярных фотографов страны, искусству фотографии. И казалось, обычный колледж, со своими хулиганами и тихонями. Уроки, общежития и тусовки. Так бы жизнь и текла, если в один момент Макс не замечает голубую бабочку, фотографирует ее, а за минуту обнаруживает в себе силу, обращать время вспять. Так и начинает наматываться наш клубок, состоящий из тайн, убийств, предательства, дружбы и выборов, за которые мы должны будем понести тяжкий груз последствий. Первые эпизоды истории не на шутку увлекают тебя и невольно начинаешь погружаться в хитросплетения сюжета вместе с главными героями. По мере продвижения истории присутствуют, как и приятные неожиданные повороты, так и спорные решения действующих лиц. Очень приятной неожиданностью стало для меня, что мои выборы действительно влияют на мир и несут последствия. От чего ты еще внимательней вслушиваешься в диалоги, и стараешься взвесить все за и против, перед принятием решений. Не очень понравился момент с альтернативной историей Хлои, для глобальной истории он был не нужен. Я понимаю хронометраж и все дела, но роли он не отыграл никакой, только немного взбесил. Также хотел отметить что кто читал или смотрел хоть несколько детективов, той сразу поймет кто настоящий убийца и что тут та да как, но это вовсе не минус. 

	Персонажи прописаны наилучшим образом. Все живые, каждый старается быть индивидуальностью со своими переживаниями и проблемами. Каждый индивид визуально различим и приятно просто походить, и пообщаться со своими одноклассниками. Некоторые персонажи спокойны и невинны, некоторые горды и заносчивы, некоторые упрямы и эксцентричные, но все они на своих местах, и убери хоть одного из них, история потеряла б частичку своей цветовой палитры. 

	Визуальный стиль, приятный и запоминающийся. Эмоции на лицах считываются интуитивно. Большая часть интерактивных предметов на первый взгляд плохо прорисована. Но при взаимодействии, предметы прорисовываются и нам открываются новые детали. Безумно помогает погружению. Что еще неоценимо помогает погрузиться в происходящие так это музыка. Когда начинала играть песня я откладывал клавиатуру и мышь в сторону, и просто начинал наслаждаться. 

	Итог. Кто еще не играл данную игрушку, немного завидую. Отличная, теплая история про дружбу, история которая скрасит несколько ваших вечеров. Особенно хорошо играется зимой.

184313029.review:
A phenomenal game that pushed the boundaries of storytelling by combining cinematic techniques with the adventure video game genre.

I’ve had many gaming experiences that I remember fondly. I love Final Fantasy 1 and 2 (aka 4 in Japan) and will never forget the moment when the whale rises from the water or Kain betrays you AGAIN… I have memorable addictive gaming experiences with Civilization 2, King’s Bounty, and Sim City 2000. These are gaming moments of history where I was not only entertained but my life or world was changed in some way from the experience.

Life is Strange is one of those moments of gaming history for me. Because technology needed a long time to evolve enough for complex gameplay, video games and movies were far apart.  It’s almost like you had three worlds: the book world where you could enter deep, entrenched worlds, movies with narrative and spectacle, and video games for shooting aliens or stomping on goombas. But those worlds collided as two genres, the adventure game genre and the blockbuster action game, began to create games that resembled movies with everything from credits before and after the game, cinematic cutscenes, and deep story and dialogue.  While the latter was more about helping you understand why you were on your quest to kill the bad guys, the former was all about experiencing another world through the perspective of the protagonist, and unlike movies and (non-Choose Your Own Adventure) books, you controlled his or her actions and participated in the story—effectively, you made it happen.

And Life is Strange brought many of those elements together—along with its contemporaries like Telltale’s The Walking Dead series—to have games with storytelling, decision making, and cinematic scenes that almost made you feel like you were playing a movie. And its story touched millions of people. Playing as Max and interacting with her classmates as well as her best friend Chloe and her family, you experience the best of the teenage angst genre, the time-travel genre, and the mystery/suspense genre all at once. And it has a killer (pun not intended) soundtrack to boot.

The Positives
-The characters are very memorable and either likable or fun or interesting. Max—other than her virtue-signaling-before-virtue-signaling-was-a-thing habit of thinking that everything that everyone does is “so interesting”—is adorable and has plenty of things that you get to do as her throughout the game.  Everything from little optional side stories of D&D gaming with friends to the slice-of-life moments of swimming with Chloe at the school after hours.  And even though I was probably one of the few to admit that Chloe is a total annoying brat who gets away with it because she’s attractive, I still came to like her despite her flaws.

-The graphics are beautiful.  When I heard they came out with a remaster, I was wondering why they needed one.  I’m sure it is great, but I thought the first one was great already.  The butterfly, the characters, the environments…it’s great.

-The story sucks you in.  I like how you’re just a kid in class one moment and then *bam* everything changes in a moment.  What a way to start this adventure.  And there’s always a new twist or a fun set piece and slice-of-life moment in the next scene.

-Peak of video games as an art form. Art is about sharing stories and perspectives with others. This draws upon artsy shows like Twin Peaks and combines those themes with fun ideas from Back to the Future, Groundhog Day, and 80s teen comedies. And what comes out of those inspirations is a great game that feels like a movie that I controlled and I remember it as if I was in a movie theater and not playing a game.


The Negatives
-Reviewing this years after I played it, I have to mention that the series and developers went downhill quickly by joining the movement of politicizing/“activizing” their games. Note that, fortunately, the developers wanted to make it an anthology and so they created other stories and didn’t ruin this one (note: I have not played the sequel, which was made by another developer). But this game was amazing in that it was just a normal game and you could choose whether you were friends or more with Chloe in the most organic way—so organic that I was surprised to have the option to kiss Chloe because I thought we were best friends. That’s how great and subtle it was. Reminds me of Dragon Age where you could romance anyone but only if you chose to pursue it.

-As I mentioned, Max’s thoughts can often be corny like they were written by someone who asked themselves what a kind person would be thinking about anything at any given time. Max thinks that everything is awesome all the time.

-You might not like how many clichés/tropes are used if you think that makes something derivative or unoriginal—I loved it because I love the time-travel genre, but I respect if you want something completely original.

-There are a lot of posts on the internet about plot holes and such, but I don’t think that any of them were too bad.


It’s hard to think of anything negative to say about this game as it’s so good.  To this day, I still listen to the Syd Matters songs from the soundtrack the way that a Say Anything fan would listen to In Your Eyes or a Back to the Future fan would listen to The Power of Love.  And it takes me back to the moment with the Butterfly and how I was sucked into a wonderful fantasy world for a while to enjoy pretending to have super powers and get to make consequential choices and take meaningful actions to help people in the story.  And for that, I highly recommend that anyone should play it.  Phenomenal game.  I don’t recommend the other LIS anthology games, but this one is on my favorite games of all time list.

クリアしました。もともと「一番好きなゲーム」とお勧めされることが多く、その高評価ぶりが気になってプレイを始めたが、結果は想像以上の感動だった。今までプレイしてきたゲームの中でも、間違いなく最高の一本だと自信を持って言える。それどころか「ゲーム業界でNo.1のストーリー」ではないかと思うほど心を揺さぶられた。少々大げさかもしれないが、それくらい興奮している。プレイ後に心に残る余韻が強烈だった。　

主人公マックスと親友クロエの物語を軸に展開されるストーリーは、心をとても揺さぶられた。
以前読んだ本で、「人生に正しい選択というものは存在しない」という科学的な研究結果について知ったのだが、このゲームは見事にそれを再現していた。

ゲームシステムも独特で魅力的だった。マックスが持つ時間を巻き戻す能力が鍵となる基本システム。プレイする前から「時間を巻き戻す」ゲームシステムだけは知っていたが、面倒くさくないか心配だったが基本的にどのタイミングで使えばよいかが明確に示されるので、難易度はそれほど高くなく、プレイヤーが困ることなく進められる工夫がされていた。また、広すぎないミニマルなエリアを探索し、人に話しかけたり、物を調べたりするのが主なプレイスタイル。この際、調べられる対象が白いチョークで輪郭を描かれたように目立つデザインになっているのも、分かりやすさと独創性を感じて好きだった。

自分は英語音声と英語字幕でプレイしたが、マックスが物を調べる際に毎回、心の中で独り言をつぶやく描写がとても印象的だった。そのつぶやきが、彼女の人柄や無邪気さを感じさせ、可愛いし味わい深かった。また、驚いたときに彼女が「Wowser! ——ワウザー！（「わあ！」の意。感嘆詞）」とよく言うのだが、そのフレーズを含め各キャラの個性的な言葉遣いなども個人的に魅力的だった。

ゲームが可能にする感情の深さを感じた。素晴らしいゲームに出会えたことに感謝。

I've been wanting to play this game for years now but there was always something stopping me. Most of the time it was that the price was too high for me, I didn't know if I should buy the original or the remake or I just forgot about it. But on August 25, 2024, I decided to finally buy it and I will never regret it. 

It's such a beautiful game with such an interesting, enjoyable, sad and sometimes even a little scary story. All the characters are so well made and you get so easily attached to many of them while disliking others so much. The scenery is so beautiful and the graphics make the game look so beautiful and unique. I stopped playing until today, at the end of December when I got to episode 5 because I was afraid to finish the game and now I'm a little sad that I'll never get to experience it for the first time again. However, the ending was so well done and words cannot describe how confused and fascinated I was by everything that happened.

So if you haven't already guessed it, I recommend this game very, very much.

183907627.review:
Narrativa que Transforma
Life is Strange conta a história de Max Caulfield, uma estudante de fotografia que descobre que pode voltar no tempo. A premissa pode parecer simples, mas o que o jogo entrega vai muito além: uma narrativa profundamente emocional, cheia de escolhas difíceis, momentos de amizade verdadeira e um peso moral que ressoa até o último instante.

A relação de Max com Chloe Price é o coração do jogo. A química entre as duas personagens é tão autêntica e bem construída que me vi conectado a elas como se fossem pessoas reais. A cada decisão tomada, eu sentia o peso das consequências, me questionando o tempo todo sobre o que era certo ou errado. E o desfecho – ah, aquele desfecho – é de partir o coração e deixar um vazio que nenhum outro jogo conseguiu preencher desde então.

Trilha Sonora Perfeita
A trilha sonora é outro elemento que torna Life is Strange insuperável. Músicas como "To All of You" de Syd Matters e "Spanish Sahara" do Foals criam uma atmosfera única, que me transporta de volta para Arcadia Bay toda vez que as ouço. É um jogo onde cada acorde e melodia têm significado, amplificando as emoções de cada cena.

Jogabilidade Intuitiva, Mas Impactante
Embora a jogabilidade seja simples, é exatamente isso que torna o jogo tão acessível. Ele te prende pela história, pelas escolhas e pelo poder de Max de manipular o tempo. É uma ferramenta que não só desafia a lógica, mas também o coração, colocando o jogador no papel de "quem controla o destino". É impossível não refletir sobre como nossas ações, mesmo as menores, podem afetar o futuro.

Por Que É o Melhor Jogo da Vida
Desde que toquei no controle em 2015, Life is Strange me ensinou que videogames são mais do que entretenimento. Eles podem ser arte, terapia e até uma jornada pessoal. Nenhum outro título me fez rir, chorar e questionar tanto sobre mim mesmo quanto esse.

Mesmo jogando em um Xbox 360, com gráficos que já eram limitados para a época, a experiência foi imaculada. A direção de arte estilizada e os diálogos memoráveis me transportaram para um mundo onde as relações humanas e os dilemas reais eram tão importantes quanto o elemento sobrenatural.

Conclusão
Life is Strange não é apenas o melhor jogo que já joguei; é um marco na minha vida como jogador e como pessoa. Ele me mostrou que escolhas importam, que o tempo é precioso e que amizades verdadeiras são raras e devem ser cultivadas. Em um mundo onde tantos jogos focam apenas na ação, este título se destaca por capturar o que significa ser humano.

Se você nunca jogou Life is Strange, está perdendo a chance de experimentar algo único, algo que pode mudar sua perspectiva sobre a vida. Para mim, desde 2015 até hoje, ele continua sendo o melhor jogo de todos os tempos.

183792009.review:
How do I start this review? 

Life is Strange is one of, if not my favorite game of all-time. It's an amazing experience, with a world and characters that I can't help but fall in love with. 

First of all, the soundtrack. It's amazing, and I listen to it almost daily while on the bus, in a car, or when I'm taking a walk. Probably my favorite soundtrack.

Secondly, the story. It's seriously amazing. I adore it. I really shouldn't have to say more.

I do highly reccommend this game, however there are still some negatives. 

First of all, the graphics. The game is almost 10 years old, and it shows. While I still very much do prefer the original over the remaster, neither of them look all that great. Some of it adds to the charm, but some of it does remind you of the game's age. 

Second, the dialouge. While I myself don't find this too much of a problem, the dialouge is rather repetitive at times, and some of the characters do sometimes say things that give of some "how do you do fellow kids" energy. Didn't bother me, but still something to keep in mind. 

Thank you for reading this review, and I hope you enjoy the game if you do decide to buy it!

183588166.review:
Нестареющая классика, изменившая индустрию трипл-А проектов в середине прошлого десятилетия. По сей день уникальные и узнаваемые механики, абсолютно тривиальный и киношный сюжет, который невозможно предугадать до конца игры, делают её очень интересной в прохождении даже спустя столько лет, не говоря уже о первом прохождении. Наверное поэтому она и стала классикой, неким эталоном, среди пионеров больших игр и серьезных студий.. В dontnod умеют наделить продукт душой, это многого стоит. LIS берет своей ванильностью, киношностью, эмоциональными качелями, на которые сажает тебя вплоть до самой последней сцены,  вне зависимости от концовки. Игра погружает тебя в определенный сеттинг, но управлять им и его «климатом» игрок вправе в течение всего времени. Всё изменчиво и динамично - прямо как в жизни. На крайний случай, всегда можно отмотать время вспять)) 
В конце концов, после прохождения ты понимаешь, что Life is strange так называется далеко не из-за необычной способности главной героини. Иногда, всё оказывается очевиднее и в этом отчасти и заключается странность жизни. Игра точно стоит тех чувств, что она вам подарит. Остаться без впечатления, скорее всего, не получится даже, пожалуй, у самого закостенелого и скептично настроенного игрока :)
Какими бы крутыми не были остальные части франшизы, я думаю, что знакомство со вселенной стоит начать именно с этой классики жанра.

183584665.review:
Una joya narrativa que respeta tu tiempo.

Menuda pedazo de historia conmovedora y personajes entrañables. Es una de esas experiencias inolvidables que desearías poder olvidar para volver a experimentar otra vez. Lamentablemente, no tenemos el poder de volver atrás en el tiempo. Su atmósfera melancólica y personajes increíblemente humanos te atrapan en esta historia en la que las decisiones que tomas realmente importan, haciéndote sentir parte de la narrativa de una manera que pocos juegos logran. Realmente te sientes satisfecho si las cosas te salen bien, o culpable si la lías garrafalmente. 

La música además es espectacular, y complementa perfectamente cada escena (siendo mis partes favoritas del soundtrack las del Episodio 5). Visualmente tiene uno de esos estilos artísticos únicos y preciosos que encajan bien con el tono de la historia. Muy buena aventura narrativa con dosis de emoción y misterio.

Además, te permite cuidar el tiempo si deseas obtener todos los logros (conseguir todas las fotos), ya que una vez completas el juego, te deja elegir el capítulo que quieres jugar, y más concretamente si quieres hacerlo en modo "recolección", lo cuál utiliza tus elecciones tomadas anteriormente para que la historia avance sola, y te deja seleccionar momentos específicos del capítulo para que puedas buscar las fotos que te faltan.
